p: Lenta et al. investigated the dichloromethane-methanol (1:1) extract of the stem bark of Diospyros canaliculata (Ebenaceae) harvested in Cameroon and obtained a new coumarinyl naphtoquinone, named canaliculin ( 97) [ 90]. The compound only exhibited weak activity against P. falciparum NF54 strain, unfortunately, along with pronounced toxicity [ 90].
